title: Rep. Joe Kennedy to Challenge Ed Markey for Senate Seat
summary: Race will pit member of an American political dynasty against a longtime member of Congress with similar progressive views. WASHINGTON-Rep. Joe Kennedy III, a member of one of America's great political dynasties, will challenge Ed Markey for his Massachusetts Senate seat, setting up a dogfight between two progressive lawmakers.

title: Warren Probes Apollo and KKR on Backing For-Profit Colleges
summary: The Massachusetts Democrat has targeted six private-equity firms amid growing congressional scrutiny of the industry. Elizabeth Warren is demanding answers from private-equity firms about their investments in for-profit colleges, the latest push by a high-profile Washington lawmaker to investigate how buyout firms affect the public.

title: Juul Faces Subpoena Threat Over Documents
summary: House subcommittee says e-cigarette maker hasn't turned over requested information. The leader of a House committee investigating Juul Labs Inc. said the e-cigarette maker has failed to turn over requested documents and warned that the panel could issue a subpoena demanding them.

title: Iran's Whip Hand
summary: Tehran thinks it's winning the fight over Trump's sanctions.. President Trump announced Wednesday that the U.S. will impose new sanctions on Iran, and later in the day proposed an international coalition at the United Nations to shape a response. Neither of these initiatives is likely to deter Iran from further attacks, as its leaders conclude that Mr. Trump has no desire for a tougher response.

title: Powell Walks the Line
summary: A divided Fed cuts rates by 25 points without a clear rationale.. This is a confusing moment for monetary policy, and apparently that extends to the voting members of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee. On Wednesday they voted 7-3 to cut interest rates by another 25 basis points to a target fed-funds rate of between 1.75% and 2%.

title: California Can't Go Its Own Way
summary: Trump's fuel policy intervention is right on policy and the law.. If you haven't heard, President Trump has declared war on California, the auto industry and the world's climate. Or that's what liberals are saying about his Administration's plans to revoke California's waiver that lets it set national fuel economy rules that raise costs for consumers across the country.

title: When Presidents Pummel the Fed
summary: Before Bill Clinton, such browbeating was the norm. Powell has endured Trump's assaults with dignity.. Two and a half cheers for my friend (that's a disclosure) Jay Powell, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board. I'll come back to the half, but the two cheers are for the exemplary way he has conducted himself in office. That includes most of his decisions, his efforts to enhance the Fed's communications, and, most important, the way he has stood up to the blusterer in chief-steadfastly, but with dignity.

title: Lebanon, Hezbollah and Iran's Emerging Client State
summary: The country was once a 'safe haven' for terrorist organizations. Now it's fully entwined with one.. After Iran's attack on a Saudi oil refinery last weekend, the U.S. sent a Navy destroyer as a show of support for allies. But the USS Ramage didn't sail to the Arabian Peninsula. It docked, bizarrely, in the Port of Beirut, in Lebanon-a country dominated by Iran's terrorist proxy, Hezbollah.

title: Having a Conversation, One Cliché at a Time
summary: Without 'going forward,' 'bring to the table' and 'tipping point,' most politicians would go silent.. In "It's Been Said Before," Orin Hargraves's excellent study of clichés, he maintains that "journalism is demonstrably the greatest depository of clichés in English," with talk radio and social media coming up fast on the outside. The reason is not merely that journalists write under pressure but that "consumers of journalism accept conventional and stereotyped ways of expressing ideas, whether consciously or unconsciously, as part of the diet."

title: Packing the Court Is a Real Threat
summary: FDR's legislation went nowhere but intimidated the justices into rewriting the Constitution.. Democrats are threatening to pack the Supreme Court by enacting legislation to expand its size if they take the White House and Senate in 2020. That would instantly replace a 5-4 conservative majority with a left-leaning one that would be irreversible unless Republicans win control of the government and expand it even further. As in 1937, when Democrats first mooted the idea, such legislation is unlikely to pass. Yet as in 1937, the threat itself may be enough to produce the desired effect by intimidating the justices.

title: 'Face to Face' Review: Put Down the Phone
summary: A Hollywood producer touts the value of looking people in the eye, having "curiosity conversations" and talking to people you may disagree with.. We are more connected than ever-sharing photos of a morning latte with Instagram followers around the globe-yet surveys find rampant loneliness. "People today are starving for genuine relationships, a sense of belonging, and the feeling of being known and understood," writes Oscar-winning producer Brian Grazer in "Face to Face: The Art of Human Connection." Such relationships are hard to build by email, and even in person. "No one," he says, "wants to keep sharing with someone fixated on their phone." He calls instead for eye contact: It is the "wifi of human connection. Just as wifi connects us to endless information on the internet, making eye contact opens up endless possibility."

title: U.S. Largess vs. Canadian Cruelty
summary: The best approach to floods is freedom and responsibility.. Canada doesn't always live up to its reputation as kinder and gentler than the U.S. Consider the victims of Hurricane Dorian, which pulverized eastern North Carolina as well as the provinces of Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island.

title: The Democrats' Stoning of Brett Kavanaugh
summary: If Joe Biden wins, the left will use the same tactics against his presidency.. For years, an enduring story line of American politics was that "the far right" was taking over the Grand Old Party of Dwight D. Eisenhower, Ronald Reagan and the Bush family. Then Donald Trump, a political idiosyncrasy running as a Republican, blew up the right-wing takeover.

title: Loathing Can't Unite the Country
summary: At the Democratic debate, candidates decried divisiveness while sowing division.. There is a tension visible in virtually every Democratic presidential contender's campaign. At last Thursday's debate in Houston, candidates offered hopeful, optimistic appeals for national unity-along with ferocious attacks on President Trump. Some even added denunciations of America. In combination, the effect was jarring.

title: California Enacts Law to Classify Some Gig Workers as Employees
summary: Gov. Newsom signs bill opposed by ridesharing companies, signals hopes to broker compromise between tech giants, labor unions. California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed legislation Wednesday intended to classify some independent contractors as employees eligible for legal protections as companies including Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. ramp up their resistance to the change.

title: Government Urged to Boost R&D Spending
summary: Funding more research in robotics, 3-D printing and other areas would boost labor productivity, think tank says. The U.S. government has publicized its investments in whiz-bang fields such as quantum technology and artificial intelligence. But to help companies remain competitive in an increasingly automated and digitized landscape, it should boost tech spending aimed at boosting productivity, researchers say.

title: Buffett Protege to Leave Berkshire, Start Own Firm
summary: Tracy Britt Cool says she wants to work with companies 'too small for Berkshire'.

title: Microsoft to Buy Back Up to $40 Billion in Stock
summary: Software giant also intends to increase its dividend 11%. Microsoft Corp. said it plans to buy back as much as $40 billion in stock and raise its dividend 11%, maintaining its record of sharing its flood of cash with shareholders.

title: Fed Cuts Rates by Quarter Point but Faces Growing Split
summary: Central bankers divided over Wednesday's decision and the outlook for further reductions.. WASHINGTON-The Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate by a quarter-percentage point for the second time in as many months to cushion the economy against a global slowdown amplified by the U.S.-China trade war.

title: Brazil Central Bank Cuts Benchmark Rate to Record Low
summary: At least one more trim is expected to come this year. BRASÍLIA-Brazil's central bank cut its benchmark interest rate as expected Wednesday, as consumer price increases remain under control amid a yearslong economic slowdown that has defied government efforts to boost growth.

title: Trump Names Robert O'Brien as National Security Adviser
summary: The hostage-affairs official with the State Department will succeed John Bolton. WASHINGTON-President Trump named Robert C. O'Brien as his new national security adviser, picking a top hostage-affairs official for the high-profile White House role at a time when the U.S. is weighing how to respond to attacks on Saudi Arabia.

title: GM Workers-Some With No Strike Experience-Gird for Longer Walkout
summary: The work stoppage is already the longest nationwide strike against GM since the 1970s; 'like we're making history'. The first strike called by the United Auto Workers against General Motors Co. in more than a decade lasted a third day, and many on the picket line Wednesday-including some hired since the last stoppage-said they are prepared to stay away longer.

title: Complaints Against NYPD Officers on the Rise
summary: Mayor Bill de Blasio attributes the increase to the Civilian Complaint Review Board's outreach. Civilian complaints against the New York Police Department have reached a five-year high, according to an official tally.

title: Mideast Petroleum Facilities Prove Difficult to Defend
summary: Saudi attack put world on notice that infrastructure is under threat. WASHINGTON-Petroleum infrastructure in Saudi Arabia and other Middle Eastern nations critical to the global economy remains vulnerable to new attacks in the future, whether from Iran, its regional allies or other groups, industry experts, security analysts and former U.S. officials warn.

title: Attorney General Probes Support on Capitol Hill on Gun Curbs
summary: William Barr is floating a potential plan on new gun curbs, but President Trump hasn't committed to support it. Attorney General William Barr is gauging support among lawmakers for a plan to expand gun background checks, signaling that the administration hasn't dismissed a significant tightening of gun rules, though President Trump hasn't indicated what he will endorse.

title: New York State Panel Hears Input on Public Campaign-Finance System
summary: The nine-member commission is empowered to review election laws, which could include a look at fusion voting. ALBANY, N.Y.-Dozens of activists, lawmakers and political-party bosses spoke at a state commission hearing Wednesday to weigh in on New York's plans for a public campaign-finance system and potential changes to the way candidates appear on the electoral ballot.

title: Falling Demand for Architects a Warning Shot for Industry
summary: Drop American Institute of Architects' monthly billing index is lowest since May 2012. The American Institute of Architects said Wednesday that its monthly billings index, which measures the demand for design services, fell to its lowest point since May 2012, a warning shot for two value sectors that this year have looked more like growth sectors.

title: Apple Communications Chief to Leave Company
summary: Mr. Dowling's planned departure comes at time of transition for tech giant. Apple Inc. said Wednesday its head of communications was leaving the company, the latest of several senior executive departures this year as the tech giant reorients its business amid flagging iPhone sales.

title: Brazil's Petros Pension Aims to Increase Private Equity Investment in 2020
summary: Declining interest rates in Brazil are encouraging public pension funds to increase their exposure to the asset class following new rules for private-equity vehicles. One of the largest state-run pension funds in Brazil could gradually resume investing in private equity next year, following a period of cutting back its exposure to the asset class and changes in the rules governing the investment vehicles themselves.

title: Fed Injects More Into Money Markets After Banks Bid Heavily for Funds
summary: Short-term funding spike raises hopes for future Fed cuts. Banks on Wednesday snapped up $75 billion on offer from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York in a second day of intervention meant to ease a crunch in overnight funding markets.

title: Comcast Cuts Price of Its Streaming Hardware From $5 a Month to $0
summary: Cable operator looks to capitalize on internet customer base with Flex box and coming Peacock streaming service. Comcast Corp. is making its streaming device available free of charge to its internet-only customers, in an effort to capitalize on its expanding broadband customer base as the battle for streaming customers ramps up.

title: Saudi Arabia Implicates Iran in Oil Attacks
summary: Military stops short of explicitly accusing Tehran of carrying out strikes. Saudi Arabia said it holds Iran responsible for attacks that debilitated Saudi oil facilities, directly implicating Tehran for the first time but stopping short of explicitly accusing it of conducting the strikes.

title: New York's Smokers' Quitline Offers Little Help to E-Cigarette Users
summary: Health officials say there isn't one protocol for stopping electronic nicotine product use; 'There's a huge treatment gap. That's the bottom line'. Thousands of callers a year to the New York State Smokers' Quitline receive help to stop smoking through education programs, counseling and nicotine-replacement therapy, including free packages of nicotine gum, patches and lozenges to reduce cravings.

title: Lawmakers Seek Ban on Chinese Drone Purchases by Federal Agencies
summary: Bipartisan bill would hit China's DJI, the world's largest maker of consumer drones. WASHINGTON-A bipartisan group of lawmakers introduced legislation on Wednesday that would bar federal agencies from buying drones from China and any other country deemed a national-security risk.

title: FedEx Shares Plummet Following Dismal Results
summary: Delivery giant's stock on track for largest decline since 2008. FedEx Corp. shares plunged the most in a decade after the company's global Express business showed its vulnerability to global trade disruptions.

title: C.H. Robinson Worldwide to Double Spending on Freight Technology
summary: Transportation broker to spend $1 billion for hiring, expanding tech tools in market pressed by digital startups. C.H. Robinson Worldwide Inc., the biggest freight broker in North America, will double its technology spending over the next five years as it fends off challenges from a growing field of digital startups.

title: SoftBank's Vision Fund to Open New York Office
summary: Firm's fifth office to tap into growing New York startup scene. SoftBank Group Corp. plans to open a New York office for its Vision Fund, marking the global investor's fifth base of operations and positioning it to tap more actively into the city's startup scene.

title: Stale Snack-Bar Sales Hurt General Mills
summary: Food maker's profit margin improved after price increases. General Mills Inc. extended its sales slump after encountering poor demand for brands including Yoplait yogurt and Nature Valley granola bars.

title: Gold Reverses Gains as Investors Turn to Fed
summary: Futures for December gold delivery fell 0.8% in aftermarket trading after rising 0.2%. Gold prices reversed gains in aftermarket trading Wednesday, after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates but signaled that officials were divided on how much to ease policy in coming months.

title: U.S. Government Bonds Hold Steady After Fed Decision
summary: Geopolitical tensions in the Middle East have helped increase demand for safer assets such as U.S. Treasurys. Prices on longer-term U.S. government-bond prices held gains Wednesday after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates by one-quarter of a percentage point and reiterated that it would "act as appropriate" to sustain the U.S. economic expansion.

title: Rule to Identify Audit Partners Doesn't Improve Audit Quality
summary: Audit quality has improved, researchers find, but they say there's little indication that the improvement is the result of a controversial rule. A rule requiring public companies to identify an individual audit partner in financial reporting has had little impact on audit quality, new research suggests.

title: White House Is Revoking California Waiver on Auto Emissions
summary: 'Auto makers should seize this opportunity,' president says on Twitter. President Trump said Wednesday that he is taking away California's power to set its own vehicle tailpipe emissions standards, escalating an environmental dispute that has trapped auto makers in the middle.

title: Stocks Climb Back as Fed Cuts Rates
summary: Fed officials signal they are divided on prospect of further rate cuts; S&P 500 flat after bouncing off lows. U.S. stocks wobbled, then staged a late-session rebound Wednesday after the Federal Reserve lowered interest rates but signaled a divided outlook for the rest of the year.

title: 'Verrocchio: Sculptor and Painter of Renaissance Florence' Review: Reclaiming the Teacher Surpassed by the Pupil
summary: Andrea del Verrocchio, Leonardo da Vinci's mentor, was a stunning innovator and a virtuoso draftsman, sculptor, and painter of psychological depth and subtlety.. Washington

title: Nordea CFO Departs Amid Wider Management Reshuffle
summary: A potential successor in the role is expected to focus on boosting efficiencies and revenues, analysts said. Nordea Bank ABP said Wednesday its finance chief is leaving, a move that comes amid a wider shake-up of the bank's management under new Chief Executive Frank Vang-Jensen.

title: Oil Spikes, Auto Strikes Join List of Supply Shocks
summary: With supply disrupted and labor markets tight, don't give inflation up for dead. In recent days, the U.S. suffered two supply shocks: an attack on Saudi oil production sent crude prices sharply higher and the United Auto Workers walked off the job at General Motors Co. , the union's first strike in 12 years.

title: Investors and the Fed: I'm OK, You're OK
summary: Federal Reserve policy makers don't expect to cut rates again this year and investors are all right with that. The big news out of the Federal Reserve Wednesday is that most policy makers don't expect to cut rates further this year. The bigger news is that, for now at least, stock-market investors don't seem all that upset.

title: Trump Orders Substantial New Sanctions on Iran
summary: Penalties would be the first U.S. policy response to last week's attack on critical Saudi Arabian oil facilities. WASHINGTON-President Trump said on Wednesday that he ordered Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin to substantially raise sanctions on Iran, the first U.S. policy response to last week's attack on critical Saudi Arabian oil facilities.

title: University of California President Janet Napolitano to Step Down
summary: 'The decision was tough-and this moment, bittersweet-but the time is right.'. University of California President Janet Napolitano said Wednesday she plans to step down next August.

title: Repo Spike Signals Wrong Kind of Volatility
summary: Wall Street trading desks will suffer as frightened clients retreat. A wild, mysterious ride in short-term funding markets isn't good news for Wall Street trading desks.

title: Fed Sees Three Dissents at Meeting for First Time Since 2016
summary: Two Fed officials wanted to hold rates steady, while a third wanted a bigger rate cut. WASHINGTON-Three Federal Reserve officials voted Wednesday against the central bank's decision to cut interest rates by a quarter percentage point, the largest number of formal dissents since Jerome Powell became chairman.

title: Former Netanyahu Ally Could Usher In His Downfall
summary: Avigdor Lieberman plays kingmaker, urging Benjamin Netanyahu and Benny Gantz to form unity government. TEL AVIV-The politician who emerged Tuesday as a possible kingmaker for Israel's next government was once an important ally of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Now he could bring about his political demise.

title: U.K. Bank Pays $4 Million to Settle Allegations of Sanctions Violations
summary: The U.S. Treasury Department had alleged that British Arab Commercial Bank processed payments of hundreds of millions of U.S. dollars related to Sudan. British Arab Commercial Bank PLC agreed to pay $4 million to settle allegations that it violated U.S. sanctions on Sudan, the U.S. Treasury Department said.

title: Insys Bankruptcy Plan Comes Up Short in Paying Justice Department
summary: The government, owed $225 million from a settlement with the opioid maker, will be splitting money from asset sales, insurance and lawsuits with other creditors. Insys Therapeutics Inc., the first drugmaker to be driven to bankruptcy as a result of litigation over the nation's opioid crisis, has outlined its plan to wind down its operations in chapter 11 bankruptcy without making good on a $225 million settlement with the U.S. Justice Department.

title: New Mexico Unveils Plan to Offer Free College Tuition
summary: If passed by legislature, plan would affect an estimated 55,000 students across state's 29 public higher-education institutions. New Mexico's Democratic Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham on Wednesday unveiled an ambitious new plan that would provide free college tuition to all in-state students.

title: Congress Approves Funding That Could Help Newark Fix Water Problem
summary: Federal funds up to $100 million can be tapped by New Jersey as bill heads to Trump to sign. New Jersey can tap up to $100 million in federal funds to help Newark fix the city's problems with elevated levels of lead in drinking water under new legislation approved by Congress.

title: McDermott Enlists Turnaround Adviser After Guidance Cut
summary: Engineering firm is working with AlixPartners on effort to stem net losses. McDermott International Inc. has engaged turnaround consulting firm AlixPartners LLP to advise on efforts to improve cash flow and stem a recent spate of net losses at the offshore oil-and-gas engineering and construction company, said people familiar with the matter.

title: Woman Accuses Epstein of Repeated Rapes and Assaults
summary: Suit filed by 'Jane Doe' appears to be the first by an unnamed victim in the July criminal indictment of late financier. NEW YORK-A woman at the center of sex-trafficking charges against Jeffrey Epstein filed a lawsuit Wednesday against the former financier's estate, describing in graphic detail for the first time her alleged recruitment at age 14 to perform sex acts for him.

title: The Pro Move for Cooking Swordfish
summary: Poaching low and slow in olive oil produces the most succulent and flavorful swordfish steaks you'll ever eat. INSPIRED BY the food of the French and Italian Rivieras, this dish from Melissa Hamilton and Christopher Hirsheimer works because of smart cooking. The chefs at Canal House Station in Milford, N.J., know that swordfish can easily dry out, so they opt for oil poaching. "When you cook it nice and slow in olive oil, the fat gently penetrates the fish," said Ms. Hirsheimer.

title: What the Interest-Rate Cut Means for You
summary: The Federal Reserve's decision to cut its short-term rate can mean different things for your mortgage, student loans and other kinds of borrowing. The Federal Reserve cut its short-term benchmark rate, dropping a quarter-percentage point to a range between 1.75% and 2%. This follows a landmark rate cut in July, the first since 2008.

title: Social Justice and Educating Our Physicians
summary: Issues such as gun violence and climate change mentioned in Dr. Stanley Goldfarb's "Take Two Aspirin and Call Me by My Pronouns" are critical to physician education and training because of their impact on the health of the patients we serve.. Issues such as gun violence and climate change mentioned in Dr. Stanley Goldfarb's "Take Two Aspirin and Call Me by My Pronouns" (op-ed, Sept. 13) are critical to physician education and training because of their impact on the health of the patients we serve.

title: Buttigieg Is Right About U.S. in Afghanistan
summary: The Taliban had nothing to do with 9/11.. Your editorial "Buttigieg's Cracked History" (Sept. 14) regarding Mayor Pete Buttigieg and his plans to withdraw from Afghanistan are inaccurate and misleading. A proper analysis of the Afghan problem should include the financing, training and manipulation of the Afghan resistance to the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan. These very jihadist leaders and their peers were greeted as classic freedom fighters in the Reagan White House. This was done despite their well-documented misogyny, religious fanaticism and brutality. Moderate voices were then routinely ridiculed as being either communist sympathizers or extreme cowards. Many of the techniques of laying IEDs and building safe havens in caves in Afghanistan and Pakistan were accomplished by CIA and Pakistani handlers.

title: Minimum-Wage Remorse: Back to the Past?
summary: Self-service supermarkets themselves were a labor-saving innovation during the Great Depression.. Regarding your editorial "Big Labor's Minimum-Wage Remorse" (Sept. 11): Oregon's proposed law limiting the number of self-checkout kiosks in grocery stores is representative of the historical opposition by labor to thousands of labor-saving innovations introduced since the start of the Industrial Revolution 250 years ago.

title: Dwyane Wade Asks $32.5 Million for Miami Beach Home
summary: The retired Miami Heat guard renovated the 14,000-square-foot estate on North Bay Road after paying $10.645 million for it in 2010. After retiring from the NBA, longtime Miami Heat star Dwyane Wade is putting his Miami Beach estate on the market for $32.5 million.

title: Netanyahu Facing Uphill Battle After Israel Vote
summary: Israel's leader vows to try to form a government despite appearing to fall short of majority and running behind rival party as votes are tallied. summary: The delivery company's breakup with the e-commerce giant will be painful until shareholders see another path to growth. FedEx isn't exactly delivering.

title: U.S. Abortion Rate Drops to Lowest Level Since 1973
summary: Researchers attribute decline to fewer pregnancies, falling birth rates. The U.S. abortion rate reached its lowest levels since the procedure became legal across the country in 1973, according to a new report released Wednesday.

summary: When will she disclose the tax hikes on average Americans?. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass) to his "Late Night" television program on CBS. "We Norwegians are born wearing skis," says the 30-year-old Oslo native, who now lives in Monaco.

title: The Most Seductive Theater Scene in New York Right Now: A Visitor's Guide
summary: Immersive theater productions-where you might be part of the show-are popping up all over New York City. The best ones take place in the oddest spaces, from an abandoned hospital to an old graveyard. SURE YOU'VE GOT the right address?" the cabdriver asked dubiously as we pulled up to a gloomy building on a back street in Brooklyn's Williamsburg neighborhood. I shared his skepticism. It was indeed my destination-Kingsland Ward at St. John, a century-old hospital-but it looked entirely abandoned. When the unmarked door creaked open, however, a woman dressed as a nurse checked my name off her list and ushered me inside. For the next two hours, 14 fellow "inmates" and I were led through 22 decorated rooms, the sprawling stage of "Then She Fell," a dreamlike theatrical piece inspired by "Alice in Wonderland." We jumped between seats at a Mad Hatter's tea party and watched acrobatic couples climb the walls together. At one point, I lay on a cot alongside the White Queen as she told me a bedtime story, while I tried not to look painfully self-conscious.

title: There Ain't No Party Like a Brexit Party Cuz a Brexit Party Is Quite Hard to Pin Down
summary: Those planning for the big national send-off don't know for sure when it's going to happen; 'we've been burned in the past'. LONDON-Britons divided over whether the U.K. should leave the European Union are finding common ground on one thing. The occasion deserves to be marked by a party.

title: How Lil Nas X Inspired a New Cowboy-Hat Craze
summary: The country rapper is just one of the urban millennials who've jumped on this unlikely Western bandwagon. Our men's fashion editor attempts to join them. Two weeks ago, I failed to buy a cowboy hat. I was visiting Santa Fe, N.M., a town filled with artsy retirees, armadillo-hide cowboy boots, and yes, traditional Western toppers. For days, at specialty stores and vintage emporiums, I plopped on every hat I could find. The most compelling was a cream-colored number I spied at a western-wear shop on the south side of town-a large hat with a grin-shaped brim and a lovely tobacco-colored band ringing its crown. On the shelf it looked promising but when I tried it on, I had to grapple with the fact that a bulbous cowboy-hat-shaped cheesecake had somehow landed on my head. I asked the only other customer in the store, a leathery gent in pointy boots and ripped jeans, for a second opinion. "I like it," he drawled approvingly. Whatever he saw, I didn't. Sheepishly, I left the store, and Santa Fe, hatless.

title: The Group Trip for People Who Hate Group Trips
summary: As independent-minded Gen Xers and baby boomers take more guided trips, tour companies are trying to make the experiences feel less like group travel. Guided group travel has some obvious appeal: Someone else makes all the plans, handles logistics and offers expert commentary at tourist sites.

title: Trump Administration to Reveal Final Plan for Revoking California Waiver on Emissions
summary: California currently has the authority to set its own rules to limit air pollutants from cars but that would change. The Trump administration plans Wednesday to revoke California's federal waiver for setting its own tailpipe-emissions rules, according to people briefed on the plans, further escalating a fight that has challenged the auto industry.

title: Among Today's Most Prized Leadership Qualities: Playing Nicely
summary: Rivals would be wise to avoid backstabbing when vying for the same plum job, recruiters say. Julie Sweet won a recent internal race to take command of consulting giant Accenture PLC for many reasons. Among the most unique: She excelled at praising colleagues she competed against for the top job, an individual familiar with Accenture said.

title: 'Sign In With Apple' Is Way Better Than Passwords-If You Can Find It
summary: Apple wants its new password killer to cut your dependency on Facebook and Google-if you can find it in the apps you use most. It's time to play Pick a Door to Your Apps-a game show that, admittedly, not many people would watch.

title: Canada's Annual Inflation Slowed in August
summary: Reading remains close to Bank of Canada's target for a sixth straight month. OTTAWA-Canada's annual inflation rate slowed slightly in August because of a price drop in gasoline and fresh vegetables, although it remained close to the Bank of Canada's 2% target for a sixth straight month.

title: Huawei Suspended From International Cybersecurity Forum After U.S. Ban
summary: A group formed to respond quickly to hacks and other cyber threats has temporarily expelled the Chinese company after legal advice. Huawei Technologies Co. has been suspended from membership in a global trade group of companies, governments and experts set up to tackle computer security breaches and share information about vulnerabilities.

title: Democrat Borrows GOP Playbook in Illinois Race for House Seat
summary: Rep. Dan Lipinski blasts his primary challenger Marie Newman's ties to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez. This item first appeared in the Capital Journal newsletter. Read today's full newsletter here or sign up here for daily updates in your inbox.

title: Missing Paychecks Leave Small Firms Scrambling
summary: FBI probes payroll processor whose woes affected about 8,000 employees at nearly 400 firms. Troubles tied to a payroll processor sent hundreds of small businesses scrambling for funds this month, triggered an FBI investigation and cast a spotlight on a critical but lightly regulated industry.

title: GM's Big Fight for Flexibility
summary: The top U.S. auto maker has more interest in showing investors it can withstand an economic downturn than in bringing the UAW strike to a quick end. Following its bankruptcy and government bailout in 2009, General Motors is under intense pressure to show it can cruise through the next downturn without too much damage. Only then can the largest U.S. auto maker expect a better stock-market valuation.

title: Justice Department Backs Opposition to New California Retirement Plan
summary: CalSavers violates the federal law that governs 401(k)-style plans, the department said in a brief filed in federal court. The U.S. Department of Justice is backing a lawsuit that seeks to invalidate a new California state retirement plan, taking aim at the growing number of states sponsoring retirement savings plans for people who lack access to one at work.

title: VC Daily: GitLab's Valuation Boost; Crypto Custody; Datadog Raises IPO Range; Women in VC Nominations
summary: Resume Subscription. Good day. Donald Trump made a fundraising trip to Silicon Valley Tuesday, with former Sun Microsystems Inc. Chief Executive Scott McNealy hosting the event, The Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Cyber Daily: Caution About Multifactor Authentication; Smart Cities Invite Smart Hacking
summary: Most Popular News. Good day. Security experts advise multifactor authentication to protect employee and customer accounts, as well as to access sensitive data and systems. But the technique comes with pitfalls, reports Adam Janofsky of WSJ Pro. Companies should streamline how they use such authentication to avoid hurting productivity.

title: Veja Makes the Sneakers You're Seeing Everywhere. Next Up: Running Shoes
summary: The company's low top sneakers are a hit across the board-celebrities, cool moms and the fashion crowd all love them. Now, after four years of development, Veja is debuting its first running shoe.. Since Veja's U.S. debut in 2014, the company's sneakers-mostly of the white low top, goes-with-everything variety, like Keds or Nike Cortez, sometimes with a splash of playful color on the pull tab or rubber V logo-seem to be everywhere. They're fixtures of New York City's sidewalks in neighborhoods like Soho and Park Slope, whether on an Instagram model or a mom pushing a stroller. Celebrities like Emily Ratajkowski, Emma Watson and Meghan Markle have been spotted wearing them. "We always smile when we see an 85-year-old woman wearing the shoe in L.A.," says Veja co-founder Sébastien Kopp. And in cities like Paris, London and Tokyo, Vejas have been popular since the original run of 5,000 pairs sold out in 2005. To date, according to the company, Veja has sold 4 million pairs of shoes in total.

title: PE Daily: Providence Closes $6 Billion Fund | Advent's Cobham Deal Under Threat | Acosta Preps Debt Revamp
summary: Resume Subscription. Good day! Thirty years ago, Jonathan Nelson founded Providence Equity Partners to invest in media and communications companies, makign it one of the earliest sector-focused private-equity firms. Since then, Providence has had its ups and downs as it navigated the dot.com boom and bust of the late 1990s and the great financial crisis of 2008 and 2009. This morning, as Chris Cumming writes, Providence is squarely focused on the future after wrapping up its eighth flagship private-equity fund with more than $6 billion.

title: The Rugby World Cup's Must-Have Accessory: a Kiwi Coach
summary: New Zealanders, preaching the world's most successful rugby gospel, are in charge of seven of the tournament's 20 teams. If the past two decades of rugby have taught us anything, it's that the World Cup is essentially a six-week exercise in figuring out whether anyone can knock off New Zealand. The answer is usually no.

title: Parmalat Founder's Art Collection Heads to Auction in Milan
summary: Van Goghs, a Monet and other paintings collected by disgraced Parmalat founder Calisto Tanzi will be auctioned in Milan in October. Milan

title: Stocks to Watch: General Mills, FedEx, Chewy and More
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session.

title: Sanders Touts Immigration Plans, but His Record Is Complicated
summary: Vermont senator wants to pause deportations, but he also has argued that too much immigration could hurt American workers. Bernie Sanders wants to temporarily halt deportations, decriminalize crossing the border and end Immigration and Customs Enforcement raids, putting him in league with some of the most liberal Democrats despite his long-held concern that too much immigration could hurt American workers.

title: Exchanges Vie With Ultrafast Traders for Mom-and-Pop Stock Orders
summary: Retail trades account for about 15% of U.S. equities volume. Exchanges are challenging high-speed traders in the battle for mom-and-pop investors' stock orders, looking to gain market share in the fiercely competitive business of U.S. equities trading.

title: Facebook Jumps on the Streaming Bandwagon With New Portal Device
summary: Portal TV will offer content from Amazon Prime and Spotify; Netflix and Disney not included. Facebook Inc. is getting into the streaming game, launching a new set-top version of its Portal device that adds to the company's bet that the future of smart homes will be social.

title: Need a Loan? Equifax Plans to Sell More Utility, Phone Records
summary: Factoring in new data could help lenders find new borrowers. Equifax Inc. will soon give consumers the option to let lenders review their electric, phone and cable payment information, the latest move aimed at providing financial firms more data to determine whether to approve loan applicants.

title: Aramco IPO: Risk Is Part of the Equation
summary: The attack on Aramco's facilities delayed its IPO but shouldn't make it impossible if the seller and buyers are ready to price in new risks. This week's drama in oil markets serves as a reminder that business is all about taking calculated risks-particularly the energy business.

title: Congress Considers Sidestepping Debate on Border-Wall Funding
summary: With deadline looming to avert government shutdown, lawmakers mull extending DHS funding to expedite passage of other bills. WASHINGTON-As disagreements about funding for a border wall again begin to consume spending talks in Congress, lawmakers are exploring an option to mitigate the controversy: putting it off until next year.

title: Corning Is No Glass House
summary: Latest warning cracks the stock, but storied company still has potential. Corning was the subject of two news releases in a 12-hour period. Investors focused on the first, but the second merits some attention.

title: National-Security Worries Threaten Takeover of U.K. Defense Firm
summary: London intervenes to review $5 billion purchase of Cobham by American private-equity firm. LONDON-The U.K. halted the $5 billion sale of a British defense company to an American investor on national-security grounds, pending further government review, in a rare move for a country that hasn't typically inserted itself in big, cross-border deal making.

title: Ad-Tech Startup Innovid Bets on Display Ads
summary: The TV ad-tech company is acquiring Herolens for $30 million. As many advertising-technology companies diversify beyond serving display ads, a category that is dominated by Alphabet Inc.'s Google, Innovid Inc. is instead making its latest bet on display.

title: Mortgage Rates Decline Ahead of Fed Meeting
summary: Cheaper borrowing costs have prompted a wave of refinancing activity that may help consumer spending. WASHINGTON-Consumers' borrowing costs have drifted lower since the Federal Reserve cut interest rates in July, fueling a wave of mortgage refinancing and helping to support household spending despite deepening economic uncertainty.

title: Fed Prepares Second Rate Cut to Cushion Against Global Risks
summary: Markets will seek clues on outlook for further reductions in new projections and at press conference. The Federal Reserve is likely to cut its short-term benchmark rate by one quarter percentage point to a range between 1.75% and 2% at the conclusion of its two-day meeting on Wednesday. The big question is what kind of clues the central bank offers about any more rate reductions.

title: Third Point's Phony Battle with Sony
summary: The Japanese conglomerate has rebuffed the activist hedge fund's calls for spinoffs, but has rewarded shareholders in other ways. Activist investor Daniel Loeb is facing another setback at Sony . But if this is what failure looks like, he should try to fail more often.

title: Index Funds Are the New Kings of Wall Street
summary: Funds tracking broad U.S. equity indexes had more assets by value than stock-picking rivals for the first time. Money managers that mimic the stock market just became the new titans of the fund-management world.

title: 'A Latin American Brother-Country': Venezuelans Seek Refuge in Spain
summary: Resume Subscription. MADRID-As dusk fell on a recent summer evening, clusters of Venezuelans flocked to Madrid's historic Mercado de Maravillas, where, for a few fleeting moments, they were transported back home.

title: The Showdown at the Window Seat
summary: There's a new level of tension brewing between passengers who insist on keeping the shades down and those who demand keeping them up to enjoy the view. Welcome to the latest airline passenger cabin conflict: Window shades up or down?

title: Google, Facebook Cozy Up to Publishers as Regulators Circle
summary: Facing mounting antitrust probes, tech platforms offer fees, news-ranking changes media outlets have pursued for years. Alphabet Inc.'s Google and Facebook Inc. are making concessions long sought by news publishers whose business has been hurt by the platforms' dominance, moves that some in the media industry see as an effort to pre-empt potential regulatory backlash.

title: Tweak to IOER Seen as More Likely Following Surge in Rates
summary: Resume Subscription. In a rapid shifting of expectations, a number of analysts now see the Federal Reserve on Wednesday approving another adjustment to a key interest rate it pays banks to park cash on its books, amid a surge in short-term borrowing rates.

title: Israel's Election Too Close to Call After First Exit Polls
summary: Neither Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud nor Benny Gantz's Blue and White have sure path to majority. TEL AVIV-Neither Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu nor his main rival commanded a majority after Israelis voted Tuesday, exit polls suggested, possibly opening a period of uncertainty over Israel's next government as conflict flares between Iran and U.S. Mideast allies.

title: Lawmakers Show Willingness to End NSA Phone-Surveillance Program
summary: Spy agency seeks to defend suspended tool during congressional hearing. Democratic lawmakers joined by some Republicans challenged the Trump administration's push to renew a domestic phone-surveillance program, expressing skepticism that the tool serves a legitimate purpose and indicating bipartisan support for letting it lapse later this year.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: How Hackers Could Break Into the Smart City
summary: The more connected a city is, the more it may be vulnerable to cyberattacks. Here are some of the potential weak spots.. Smart cities are coming. And you can be sure that hackers won't be very far behind.

title: U.S. Sues Snowden Over New Book
summary: Government seeks to seize financial proceeds and stop former intelligence contractor from giving speeches related to book. The U.S. Justice Department on Tuesday filed a civil lawsuit against Edward Snowden, arguing the former intelligence contractor violated government nondisclosure agreements by publishing a new book about his 2013 leaks of classified surveillance programs.

title: Discovery of Document Led to Arrest of Canadian Intelligence Official
summary: RCMP and FBI were investigating a network suspected of cocaine distribution and money laundering when findings triggered an internal probe. The investigation that led to the arrest last week of a senior Canadian intelligence official was triggered by the discovery in 2018 of a document held by a Vancouver businessman who was suspected of operating a mobile-phone network used to distribute narcotics and payments, a person familiar with the matter said.

title: Oil-Thirsty Asia Feels the Strain After Saudi Attack
summary: Many in the region have been turning more toward Saudi Arabia as U.S. sanctions hit Venezuela and Iran. Effects from an attack on Saudi Arabia's oil infrastructure this past weekend threatened to ripple across Asia, which has spent much of the past year increasing its reliance on crude exports from the kingdom.

title: Tips for Keeping Your Mobile Phone (Relatively) Safe
summary: You can't eliminate all the personal data your phone collects and shares about you. But you can limit it.. Can you stop your phone from leaking personal data about you?

title: Should Cities Ever Pay Ransom to Hackers?
summary: Some say paying hackers to release hijacked data encourages more attacks. Others say it can be the responsible thing to do.. Cities across the U.S. face a growing threat from ransomware, where cybercriminals infiltrate computer systems and hijack data, vowing to delete critical files unless they receive payment.

title: Companies Compete to Be Cryptocurrency Custodians
summary: The battle pits some of the biggest financial-services companies against startups. What is the safest way to store digital currencies?

title: Do Messaging Apps Fit Into the Workplace? Not Always Comfortably
summary: Ephemeral messages raise questions about data security and compliance with rules concerning corporate communications. Messaging apps that can make their messages disappear, such as WhatsApp, Signal and Telegram, have become more widespread in the workplace. The services, which allow users to delete content within a short period, are used both for casual conversations and sensitive conversations. But their presence in the workplace is creating tension, particularly for companies that have to log communications and maintain records.

title: White House Looks to Supreme Court to Rein In Consumer Finance Agency
summary: The CFPB was created under the Dodd-Frank Act in the wake of the mortgage-lending crisis. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration told the Supreme Court Tuesday that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is unconstitutional because Congress limited the president's power to remove the agency's director before his or her five-year term expires.

title: Streaming War Spurs Classic-TV Arms Race
summary: Rights to 'Seinfeld,' 'Friends,' 'Big Bang Theory' and other old shows attracted over $2 billion in recent months. Entertainment heavyweights have spent more than $2 billion on classic television shows in recent weeks while signing talent for new programming, in an effort to win over streaming customers who soon will have many more options to choose from.

title: Intelligence Office Rebuffs Subpoena on Whistleblower Complaint
summary: Refusal escalates tension between congressional panel and overseer of spy agencies. The Office of the Director of National Intelligence defended on Tuesday its decision to withhold from the House Intelligence Committee details of a whistleblower's complaint and rebuffed demands that acting intelligence director Joseph Maguire appear before the panel this week to testify.

title: Sony Rejects Third Point's Proposal to Break Up Company
summary: Daniel Loeb's hedge fund called for spinoff of Sony's semiconductor business. Sony Corp. turned down a request by activist investorDaniel Loeb for a spinoff of the profitable Sony unit that supplies parts for iPhone cameras, saying that keeping the business in-house would preserve synergies.

title: New Yorkers Equally Dim on Trump, De Blasio, Poll Shows
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo, a Democrat, saw his favorability rating tick up. In their home state, New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is just as unpopular as President Trump, according to a poll released Tuesday.

title: Saudi Arabia Set to Return to Normal Oil Production Levels by End of Month
summary: Energy minister says Aramco IPO will move forward. Saudi Arabia will soon restore most of its oil output and return to normal production levels in weeks, the country's energy ministry said Tuesday, following the attacks last weekend on the country's facilities that hobbled the world's largest oil exporter.

title: Calpers Switches Developers for Sacramento Project
summary: Pension giant axes CIM Group and hires Hines. California's public worker pension system picked Houston-based Hines to take over a beleaguered real-estate project in its hometown of Sacramento.
